com.ooyala.android

Interface PlayerInfo

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultPlayerInfo

    public interface PlayerInfo
    PlayerInfo is a collection of information that describes the capabilities of the playback device. These are used e.g. when negotiating with servers so they can choose the most appropriate asset encodings.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAdditionalParams()
      Additional params send to the SAS request.

      Returns the maximum video height supported by the device

      Returns the maximum video width supported by the device

    • Method Detail

      • getDevice

        java.lang.String getDevice()
        The string that represents the device for playback authentication
        Returns:
        a denotation of the device.

      • getSupportedFormats

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSupportedFormats()
        A set of formats supported by the device. See Stream class' Delivery Types
        Returns:
        a set of supported formats.

      • getSupportedProfiles

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSupportedProfiles()
        A set of profiles supported by the device.
        Returns:
        a set of supported profiles.

        int getMaxWidth()
        Returns the maximum video width supported by the device
        Returns:

      • getMaxHeight

        int getMaxHeight()
        Returns the maximum video height supported by the device
        Returns:

      • getMaxBitrate

        int getMaxBitrate()
        Returns the maximum bitrate supported by the device
        Returns:

      • getUserAgent

        java.lang.String getUserAgent()

      • getAdditionalParams

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAdditionalParams()
        Additional params send to the SAS request.
        Returns:
        a map with key, value pairs that will be added as query parameters in the HTTP SAS request.
